title: Lolking's change, understanding pick-rates.

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body:
Lolking is the main website I use for checking statistics, but recently they have updated their interface, and now I don't understand the pick-rate calculation. All the pick rates for the champions are very different (much lower) from what they were before the change.

Azir and Sol for example had around a 1.6% pick rate, and now they are 0.4% and 0.7%. While champions like Lee and Thresh who were wayyy upwards of 20% last week (before the change), are now around 6%.
The win/ban rates seem to be similar to before, its just the pick rates that have changed. Which confuses me...

Obviously Lee and Thresh didn't drop 14%+ popularity within a week, so its clear that lolking must have changed the way they calculate pick-rates (or something). But i now don't understand what the pick rates mean, or how they relate to what they were beforehand. 

I know this may be a dumb question...

But if someone could explain whats going on, or help me understand it, that would 
be so helpful xD

thanks haha

replies.body: Is it possible it reset with the ranked season?
I thought that as well, but if that was the case, the ban-rates would have changed as well.
